main event: A ground visual observation of an unidentified orange object that traveled past to the west and then banked steeply 90 degrees in Kansas City, Missouri on February 27, 1959.
interesting points: The object was reportedly all lit up and approximately 100 feet in diameter.
The object was observed for 5-6 minutes and was seen traveling from east to west before banking sharply to the south.
The observer was driving an automobile and saw the object at an elevation of 1,500 to 2,000 feet.
A telescope was used to observe the object about 20 minutes after the initial sighting, and it showed the object to be level and transiting at 25x power.
Wind conditions were reported, with surface winds at 6 knots from 180 degrees, and higher altitude winds up to 50 knots from various directions.
sighted object: An orange, lit-up object approximately 100 feet in diameter
